comments.author: nioctib_100
comments.body: When you make the most of school, it's the most valuable time of your life. It is the absolute best place to hone your social skills and learn to be a good "people's person," someone who just gets along with everyone. Try to see the value in every different subject, and learning to think critically to solve problems translates to everything meaningful you'll do for the rest of your life. School is underrated among today's entrepreneurs.

comments.author: smail778
comments.body: Both going to school and learning creative skills can be beneficial to a youth when they are older. It depends on the individual's goals and aspirations. Here are some advantages of each option:Going to school:Developing a strong academic foundation: School provides a structured learning environment and a well-rounded education that can help individuals develop strong academic skills and knowledge.Building a professional network: Going to school can also provide opportunities to build a professional network through connections with teachers, peers, and alumni.Obtaining qualifications: School can provide individuals with qualifications such as degrees, diplomas, or certifications that are recognized by employers and can enhance job prospects.Exposure to diverse perspectives: School exposes individuals to diverse perspectives and ideas, promoting critical thinking and empathy.Learning a creative skill:Developing creativity and innovation: Learning a creative skill can help individuals develop creativity and innovation, which are increasingly valued in the job market.Building a portfolio: Developing a creative skill can result in a portfolio of work that can showcase talent and be used for future job applications or self-promotion.Providing a source of fulfillment: Learning a creative skill can provide individuals with a sense of fulfillment, personal satisfaction, and an outlet for self-expression.Offering flexibility and autonomy: Learning a creative skill can also provide flexibility and autonomy, allowing individuals to work independently or start their own businesses.

comments.author: mich
comments.body: I strongly believe it is more important first to go to school to learn and obtain the necessary skills for the career that you want in your future. It would not surprise me if a young kid was so gifted and talented in playing soccer that he did not need any school means he will not need it in the future. School is more important because you get to learn the basic skills that you will use in daily life for example reading, writing, and math. Even if you were taught the skill of hunting, fishing, and farming at some point you will have to you the skills taught in school to even do business. Today the majority of office or administrative jobs require you to have a high school diploma or even a college degree. If you do some type of general labor, or construction jobs do not always require you to have any type of schooling. However, these types of jobs are very hard on the body because they will require the use of your body by digging, picking up, pulling, walking, squatting, and constantly doing repetitive movements that will eventually take a strain on your body. This is why our parents perhaps did not have the opportunity to go to school and get a degree. Always encourage me to go to school and get a degree and get a good career so that I will not be miserable stuck with a job that would not make me happy.
